glsa.title: klibc: Command Injection
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in klibc could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary shell code.

background.p: klibc is a minimalistic libc used for making an initramfs.

description.p: The ipconfig utility in klibc writes DHCP options to /tmp/net-$DEVICE.conf, and this file is later sourced by other scripts to get defined variables. The options written to this file are not properly escaped.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted DHCP reply, which could execute arbitrary shell code with the privileges of any process which sources DHCP options.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
